description: Lucille Ball stars as Lucy Carmichael, a widowed mother with two children living in California. She falls into a job when visiting the Vice President of the Bank, Theodore J Mooney (Gale Gordon), but is far from being a competent secretary. This tape includes four madcap tales including: "Lucy & the substitute secretary"; Lucy meets the woman who is to replace her whilst she is on holidays. She begins to worry when she discovers her replacement ended up superceceding the last secretary she worked for. Lucy is up to her devilish best to prevent this from happening. "Lucy flies to London"; Lucy wins first prize in a dog food jingle contest; a trip to London. The holiday starts off on shaky ground when she finds herself seated next to Mr Mooney on the plane, guest stars include Pat Priest and James Wellman. "Lucy & the bean queen"; Mr Mooney invests in a new product, 'Bailey's barbequed beans' for one of their major clients and Lucy turns out to be their biggest investor, for an unusual reason. Guest starring Ed Begley. "Lucy & the babysitter"; Lucy looks for another job to prove to Mr Mooney that she has opportunities to find something better. She finds a job babysitting through an agency, only they omit to tell her she is looking after chimpanzees and not children. Guest stars include Mary Wickes and the Marquis Chimps. Based on the book "Life without George" by Irene Kampen.
